page.title: 17Marsworth Women's Institute
page.content: FIRST MEETING at the social Centre on 18th June 1946,with thirteen members. Still meeting in the same place, membership now 35 with 2 founder members. Todays programme wider than could ever have been envisaged in 1946. SPEAKERS tell of visits to U.S.A., Russia ,distance no problem. Learning Crafts_Glass Blowing and engraving, pewter work, cookery including microwave, all forms of embroidery, lace making and flower arranging. Social, money insurance problems and computers have been studied.11 meetings a year plus coffee mornings, garden parties, jumble sales, rambles and outings. Twice a year it meets with 4 other Local Institutes forming the Beacon Group.A Marsworth representative alternates with Long Marston at the National A.G.M.at The Albert Hall, London.
